programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond gets behind the wheel of the mid-engined Alfa Romeo 4C on the shores of Lake Como in Italy - but his enjoyment of the lightweight vehicle is disturbed by the arrival of Jeremy Clarkson, who demands a race against his quad bike. Jeremy also visits Belgium, putting the McLaren P1 hypercar to the test in Bruges and around the Spa-Francorchamps Formula One circuit - and its combined power output of more than 900bhp generated from electricity and turbocharged petrol V8 power is likely to cause astonishment. Meanwhile, James May spends time at Camp Bastion in Afghanistan to learn about the army's vehicle redeployment efforts, and Thor star Tom Hiddleston tries to coax the best time he can muster from the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: A man calls 999 claiming his car has been stolen, but when the vehicle turns up crashed into a wall with cans of cider in the footwell, James is suspicious to say the least.

programme.title: Sin City Motors
programme.desc: Reality TV show following the exploits of eccentric master fabricator Steve Darnell, who invites cameras into his workshop as he builds customised cars from junk.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The three petrolheads demonstrate their love of small cars with a trip to Ukraine. Jeremy Clarkson chooses a Volkswagen Up for the journey, while Richard Hammond takes a Ford Fiesta and James May opts for a Dacia Sandero. On their adventure, the trio absorb the history of the Crimean Peninsula, including a visit to an old submarine pen - but the carefree exploration looks likely to become a chore when Jeremy, Richard and James are challenged to a long drive north through the expansive country, during which they must combat serious boredom. And as if that wasn't arduous enough, a new task is set when they arrive in Kiev - a trip into the wasteland of Chernobyl. This edition also features a track test of the Danish Zenvo ST1 supercar and James Blunt returns for another drive in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond visits Abu Dhabi's Yas Marina circuit to drive the Porsche 918 Spyder, a four-wheel-drive hybrid hypercar capable of astonishing speeds thanks to the 886 horsepower it can generate from its screaming V8 petrol engine and electric motors. Jeremy Clarkson and James May join forces to create a public information film to promote safer cycling, with their efforts presented to a panel of experts including members of Westminster Council and Olympic gold medal-winning rider Chris Boardman. Meanwhile, Jeremy - who has promised to change his name to Jennifer if the Porsche is faster around the test track than the McLaren P1 driven earlier in the series - compares the seventh-generation Volkswagen Golf GTI to BMW's critically acclaimed M135i. Breaking Bad star Aaron Paul fires up the Reasonably Priced Car to see what lap time he can achieve.

programme.title: QI

Hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.sub-title: Would I Lie to You? At Christmas
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts a festive edition of the comedy panel show in which the participants aim to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory. Joining team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the Christmas fun are former Test Match Special commentator Henry Blofeld, Witless star Kerry Howard, broadcaster the Rev Richard Coles and BBC News presenter Clive Myrie. They all reveal amazing stories, but are they telling the truth, or making it all up?.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Comedy panel show, with Strictly Come Dancing judge Craig Revel Horwood, actress Sheila Hancock and 8 Out of 10 Cats regular Jon Richardson arguing to have the things they hate consigned to the notorious room, while host Frank Skinner has the final say. Their gripes include house guests, women's toilets and dancing - and one of the celebrities even wants rid of their own brain.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Former BBC Breakfast presenter Bill Turnbull, Death in Paradise star Ben Miller and comedienne Jo Brand compete to have their pet hates banished on the light-hearted panel show chaired by Frank Skinner. programme.title: Asian Provocateur
programme.desc: Romesh Ranganathan parts ways with his mother temporarily for a spiritual journey across Mexico with his uncle Ragu. Originally planned as a trip Ragu was hoping to take with Romesh's father before his death, the trek sees the pair take in a blindfolded spirit walk through rugged jungle terrain, and a terrifying simulated illegal border crossing into the US. While Romesh dials down his usual negativity for his uncle's sake, nothing can prepare him for the uncomfortable horror of an authentic Mexican '80s night, or an encounter with a local shaman that once again places the comedian face-to-face with a live chicken.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston travels to Jerusalem in search of Solomon's Temple. When the Romans sacked the city in 70AD, the fabled Treasure of Solomons was believed to have been looted and taken back to Rome. However, it is possible it was hidden away by the High Priests. Archaeologists Dr Shimon Gibson and Kate Raphael have dedicated their lives working out what actually happened, and discuss whether it is possible that Solomonic and Roman treasures lie undiscovered under Jerusalem.

On occasion, they may need moving, which is the purpose of the Boka Vanguard, the planet's largest heavy lift ship, capable of sinking itself, floating under its cargo and then lifting it up to be moved anywhere on the planet with sea. This extraordinary work of engineering is capable of carrying the Eiffel Tower and the Statue of Liberty at the same time.

programme.title: Monster Ships

programme.title: Ronnie Kray and the Pervert Peer
programme.desc: Fifty years ago, the Kray twins rose from small-time racketeers to head the most powerful criminal organisation London had ever seen. This documentary about the affinity between the upper echelons of society and the criminal underclass reveals how they built their empire on fear, violence and extortion - as well as Ronnie's alleged homosexual relationship with a prominent Tory peer.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: Documentary uncovering and examining hidden structures built by the Nazis, from tunnels to towers, artillery sites, resistance nests and communication centres. The first edition focuses on the Channel Island of Guernsey, which Hitler occupied and fortified over the course of five years.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of three preserved steam railway lines - the South Devon Railway heritage line, the Ffestiniog and Welsh Highlands Railway and the Great Central Railway. Sports scientist Megan Smith has a dream of tending the fire of a steam locomotive on the Ffestiniog & Welsh Highland Railway, and she stokes the bolier of NG143 and sets off along the 25 miles from Caernarfon to Porthmadog.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: At the Ffestiniog and Welsh Highlands Railway, manager Stephen Greig is trying to ensure that all goes to plan ahead of the opening of the new station at Caernarfon.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: At South Devon, engineer Ray Lee is working to bring a loco back in to service. There is also a visit to the SS Kingswear paddle steamer In Dartmouth, the oldest vessel of its kind.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: On the Welsh Highland Railway, trainee Claire Oates takes her driving test, while chef Alex and manager Michelle prepare a dinner for 130 people on the East Lancashire railway.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough investigates the opportunities tides create for marine life, showing giant stingrays gliding on currents for a rest, South African sea snails surfing the waves in pursuit of a meal, crabs playing football on a beach, and bottlenose dolphins embarking on a dangerous game of catch. In the oceanic world each turn of the tide can mean life or death for its inhabitants.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Exploring the wealth of marine life that inhabits the ocean's edge, dealing with the dangers of an ever-shifting environment. David Attenborough observes nesting seabirds in east Russia, Patagonian killer whales, Newfoundland caplin fish, walruses, and Brazilian green turtles - which make their annual expedition to an island in the middle of the Atlantic to lay their eggs.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough narrates the documentary exploring Earth's natural history and the factors that have affected it. The first edition examines how the sun affects life on Earth through the seasons, following a polar bear preparing its cubs for a long journey to avoid becoming stranded on floating glaciers. Narrated by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties
programme.desc: The late 1960s saw the first regular transmission of colour television, and the music world followed the trend with the launch of BBC television show Colour Me Pop. This episode features some of the programme's highlights, including performances by the Who, the Kinks, the Small Faces, the Bonzo Dog Doo-Dah Band and the Jimi Hendrix Experience.

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties

programme.desc: Chris travels from Bangkok in Thailand to Mandalay in Myanmar, tracing the route of the notorious Burma-Siam Railway. The 250-mile line was built by the Japanese during the Second World War using enslaved Asian workers and Allied PoWs, and Chris visits the famous site of the Bridge on the River Kwai along the way.

programme.title: The British Middle Class
programme.desc: Historian and broadcaster Tristram Hunt examines the social class's origins. He discovers how the backlash against the landed aristocracy began with a group of radical thinkers who craved progress and used their money from industry to begin a process of urban enlightenment. However, the growth of mass production led the newly moneyed leaders to move further away from the factories, beginning the trend for suburban living as a mark of status - though it meant the middle classes turning their back on where they came from.

programme.title: Medieval Murder Mysteries
programme.sub-title: Juan Borgia: A Death in the Dynasty
programme.desc: The infamous Borgia family was devastated when favourite son Juan was murdered in 1497. Here, modern experts set about cracking the case and fingering the killer.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Jeremy Isaacs' classic documentary explores the Second World War's powerful legacy. For many people the conflict was the most significant experience of their lives, but it also left millions dead - ordinary civilians and victims of persecution, as well as military casualties. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The untold secret story of war production that shaped the Second World War, beginning with how the German aviation industry came to dominate the skies of Europe.

programme.title: War Factories

programme.desc: Kevin Norris and Kieran Chisnall move three state-of-the-art trains, fresh in from Japan. They need to transport them from the North East port of Redcar to a factory in Doncaster.

programme.title: Murder Maps

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: The crimes of Scottish serial killer Peter Manuel, who murdered at least eight people between 1956 and 1958 in the Greater Glasgow area.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: The crimes of Amelia Dyer, who promised mothers that for a fee she would adopt their babies and raise them as her own. In fact, she neglected and murdered countless infants over a 30-year period in Victorian Britain. This episode tells the story of Dyer and of Evelina Marmon, one of the desperate young mothers she deceived.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Rene narrowly escapes 258 exploding Christmas puddings and quickly becomes embroiled in another daring plot proposed by Michelle and the Resistance.

programme.desc: The comedian begins the next leg of his trip in Kasama, northern Zambia. His first stop is the town of Mpika, where he meets college students training to be locomotive drivers. Next, in the capital Lusaka, he reveals how the first railways were built to access the country's rich mineral wealth, and watches craftsmen cutting emeralds and rubies - before being let loose on a pair of bejewelled cufflinks. Griff then reaches the spectacular Victoria Falls on his way to Zimbabwe's second-largest city, Bulawayo.

programme.desc: Baz treats a female prisoner who slashed her arm after her lover ended their relationship, and discovers her emotional patient is also heavily pregnant. A belligerent man realises that Sam is gay and demands to be treated by another nurse.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Sheelagh arrests a man accused of deliberately infecting women with HIV, but Leela reckons her colleague is prejudiced against the colour of the suspect's skin - and when she learns Sheelagh was demoted to PC because of a racism allegation, it seems her worst fears are confirmed. Jim is appalled when his ex-wife's decomposing body is found, and Neil is faced with hard evidence of his father-in-law's fondness for rent boys.

programme.desc: Unwelcome visitors at the Meal Machine cause problems for Ian, Grant suspects Phil is in love, and Sharon struggles to make a decision.

Miranda Raison (Sugartown) and Neil Stuke (Silk) guest star in the Caribbean crime drama, with Ben Miller and Sara Martins.

programme.desc: A Home Office pathologist joins the team to help discover the identity of a dead girl found in woodland in 1987. Meanwhile, Lane confronts his fears by revisiting the crime scene. Detective drama, guest starring Timothy West and Jane Asher.

programme.desc: Oz falls in love with a German girl, and plans to marry her - and the fact he has a wife and son back home seems to be of little concern. Jimmy Nail stars.

programme.desc: When a French diplomat to a secret international meeting is found dead, Murdoch is drafted in to temporarily impersonate him - but political and sexual intrigue complicate matters.

programme.title: Life on Mars
programme.desc: A drug dealer dies while in police custody and Sam suspects a cover-up within the unit. He orders a full investigation, though it seems none of the other officers is prepared to help. To Gene's relief, the pathologist's report appears to put everyone in the clear, but when the truth about the criminal's demise emerges, it is up to the 21st-century cop to decide whether to reveal it. John Simm and Philip Glenister star.

programme.desc: The investigation into the murder of a bookies' clerk leads the team to 29-year-old Vic Tyler - who Sam is shocked to discover is his own father. Meanwhile, Gene sees an opportunity to bring down a crime syndicate.

Elsewhere, Samantha is appalled to learn Abi is carrying Hugh Wallis's baby and Terry begins to doubt whether his brother is guilty of the child abuse charges.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Samantha begins to feel she's trapped in a never-ending nightmare when a confrontation with Abi leads to yet another revelation - she intends to marry her erstwhile kidnapper Hugh. Turning to Phil for help, Samantha hatches a plan to snatch her pregnant, brainwashed daughter from the psychopath's clutches - but it seems she may have underestimated the extent of his cunning. Community Support Officers Laura Bryant and Colin Fairfax are assigned to Sun Hill, where they are greeted by a contemptuous outburst from Dale, and Honey oversteps the line when she attempts to console a distraught husband whose wife has gone missing.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Hugh Wallis turns the tables on Sam Nixon by dropping in at Sun Hill and accusing her of abducting her own daughter. As the tug of love moves toward a dramatic conclusion, Sam desperately tries to make Abi realise she has been brainwashed - and Jack Meadows isn't as supportive as he might be. Elsewhere, Scott Burnett's wife is found murdered and Honey Harmon oversteps the bounds of duty when she attempts to comfort the grieving widower. Drama, starring Lisa Maxwell and Georgia Moffett.

programme.title: Emma
programme.desc: Bafta award-winning writer Sandy Welch's dramatisation of Jane Austen's novel, first published in 1815. Romola Garai stars as the independent Emma Woodhouse, who believes she is a skilled matchmaker and tries to pair up her friends and acquaintances. She takes Harriet Smith under her wing and encourages the woman to set her sights higher than her current suitor - against Mr Knightley's warnings about the dangers of meddling. With Jonny Lee Miller, Michael Gambon, Jodhi May and Tamsin Greig.

programme.title: Emma
programme.desc: While continuing her efforts to set up Harriet and the vicar, Emma looks forward to meeting Frank Churchill at the Christmas party, but when he fails to show up she becomes the subject of Mr Elton's unwanted attention. Later, village gossip focuses on the arrival of Jane Fairfax and a piano she was given by a mystery admirer, leaving the matchmaker reluctant to believe Mr Knightley could have sent the gift. Drama, starring Romola Garai, Louise Dylan, Blake Ritson and Laura Pyper.

programme.title: Emma
programme.desc: The heroine plans a ball with Frank, and wonders whether she has feelings for him. Despite having a wonderful time at the event, she still feels trapped, and with the matchmaking effort officially abandoned, becomes increasingly bored. However, her spirits are raised by Mr Knightley's proposal for a group outing to Box Hill, where he tells her he thinks Frank and Jane are in love. Drama, starring Romola Garai and Michael Gambon.

programme.title: Emma
programme.desc: The outing to Box Hill ends in disaster when Emma insults Miss Bates. After being berated by Knightley, she realises her behaviour was shameful and tries to make amends, but Jane refuses to speak to her. When Frank's overbearing aunt dies, the Westons expect him to propose to Emma, but his subsequent actions start a chain of events that shocks the heroine, resulting in the realisation of a truth she previously dismissed. Romola Garai and Jonny Lee Miller star in the final instalment of Sandy Welch's dramatisation of Jane Austen's novel.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: A Christian Scientist couple refuse medicine for their newborn baby, leaving Sister Julienne questioning the nature of absolute faith. However, the case becomes more complicated when the parents are accused of harming their child. Barbara uses her initiative to communicate with a pregnant Sylheti woman who cannot speak English, although using the patient's young son to translate provides new problems. Sister Mary Cynthia returns to Nonnatus House and a woman catches handyman Fred's eye.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: A diabetic teenager faces a tough time after falling pregnant, a situation complicated by her boyfriend's criminal past. Nurse Crane offers what support she can - but the girl's life is endangered when the young lovers go on the run. A case of petty theft brings a group of Irish travellers to the attention of the midwives, who end up treating a newborn infant and looking after an expectant mother, and it seems Fred's romance is on the up when he asks Violet to accompany him to a fundraising dance.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The daughter of a man held responsible for a fatal boating accident on the Thames comes forward with new evidence, claiming that a property developer sabotaged the vessel. The case means putting Strickland's wealthy sailing friends under the spotlight, much to the team's delight. Guest starring Barbara Flynn (Cranford).

programme.title: Wallander
programme.desc: The detective investigates when a body is found half-buried in a swamp. Visiting her home, Wallander discovers signs of an intruder and that the dead woman's daughter is missing. The return of a lost love distracts him from the case at hand, as he encounters a gang of bikers that have been causing trouble in the area and begins to suspect he is being watched.

programme.title: The Last Post
programme.desc: Drama about military police and their families faced with political and personal conflicts in a 1960s British colony on the Red Sea coast. An officer and his wife arrive in Aden, where he is to replace a much-loved captain. He soon has to adjust to life on the frontline, along with resentment among the men that he was appointed instead of the already-present Lt Ed Laithwaite. Honor is taken under the wing of Laithwaite's wife, Alison, who had been having an affair with Captain Page. Starring Jessie Buckley and Jeremy Neumark Jones.

programme.title: Tess of the D'Urbervilles
programme.desc: Angel and Tess are on their honeymoon when he decides it is time for them to admit their former transgressions, but while she forgives his, he is appalled by what his new wife tells him and heads off to Brazil to set up a farm there by himself. She then finds a job on a bleak farm run by Groby and bumps into Alec, who claims he is a changed man and proposes marriage. Gemma Arterton stars.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: A reluctant Brian enters an addiction centre run by monks to treat his alcoholism, but soon becomes bored and looks for a distraction. He finds one when a chance remark leads the team to reopen an investigation into the death of a heroin user nine years previously - and to help reveal the truth, Gerry is sent undercover as a sex addict. Richard Wilson and Fay Ripley guest star.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Jack examines a case previously undertaken by a deceased colleague, who was convinced that the alleged suicide of a journalist was a cover-up by the American government. Enlisting the help of a UFO-spotter, the team discovers the reporter witnessed a mysterious air crash near a US Air Force base, and the retired officers try to track down the original personnel to get some answers. Guest starring Mark Williams, Glynis Barber, Michael Brandon and Raquel Cassidy, with Amanda Redman.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Tony tries to help Jacko forget Julie by taking him on a double date, while Jessica exposes corruption in high places. The McCleods hear the patter of tiny feet and recent events finally take their toll on Mark, who makes an inspection of the barracks go with something of a bang.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Drysdale decides to send the boys on an escort mission to Africa, but it proves to be a fiasco on every level - particularly for Jeremy, who first refuses to follow the CO's orders to the letter, then has a bitter reunion with ex-wife Lilian that sets the sparks flying. Mark also resurfaces, as a mercenary soldier fighting for the enemy and keen to gain revenge on his former King's Own colleagues.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Sheelagh arrests a man accused of deliberately infecting women with HIV, but Leela reckons her colleague is prejudiced against the colour of the suspect's skin - and when she learns Sheelagh was demoted to PC because of a racism allegation, it seems her worst fears are confirmed. Jim is appalled when his ex-wife's decomposing body is found, and Neil is faced with hard evidence of his father-in-law's fondness for rent boys.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Diane's anxiety over the coroner's inquest into Dominic's death is compounded by feelings of nausea, and Ric suggests her physical symptoms might mean she's pregnant. Matt and Dean compete for the attention of a patient's daughter, but a hung-over Mubbs has no time for their messing around. However, he's grateful for the help when they stop him making a serious mistake.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Mark and Eve try to make good impressions as Christmas nears, motivated by possible promotions in the pipeline. Baz and Charlie harbour hostile feelings towards each other, and matters come to a head at the department's party when Elliot asks the pair to lead them into a slow dance.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Leela and Sheelagh find themselves at odds over the suspicious death of a baby when it seems accusations of abuse directed at the infant's asylum-seeker parents could be fuelled by racism. Honey accuses Amber of trying to ruin her relationship with Steve - then displays breathtaking hypocrisy by falling into bed with Scott Burnett. Neil's day goes from bad to worse as Phil taunts him about his disgraced father-in-law and Andrea returns to the station, only to plant a kiss on Smithy.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Cockroaches at the Meal Machine threaten Ian's success. Rachel's patience is threatened by her mother's surprise visit, and Pauline comes home to find her family gone.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Arthur and Pauline are finally united in Leigh-on-Sea, but has their marriage survived the long separation? Rachel's mother continues to meddle in her life.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Stuart 'Recall' McKenzie joins Blue Watch, and there are a series of incidents involving schoolchildren on their half-term break.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Finding himself in dire financial straits, Lovejoy borrows 100,000 from a loan shark using his daughter Viki's flat as security. Unfortunately the deal backfires, and he's forced to use every ounce of his ingenuity to ensure they both emerge unscathed. Frank Finlay guest stars, with Ian McShane.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim finds himself the target of a ruthless villain when he tries to help Charlie with a problem from his past. John Nettles and Terrance Alexander star.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Joe meets up with Roxy but her husband is not pleased to see him. Mr Boswell and Lilo Lill are in a watchman's hut when an accident occurs.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: Ted has a chance of stardom when he is hired as a late replacement at an uptown show for a fellow comedian. It is rumoured that talent scouts from the TV show Opportunity Knocks will be in the audience. Classic comedy following life at Maplin's holiday camp, starring Paul Shane, Su Pollard and Ruth Madoc.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel's script makes it onto American TV, but the show gets a mixed reception. The couple make a wise decision in refusing Alistair's invitation to enjoy New York hospitality. Comedy, starring Geoffrey Palmer and Judi Dench.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Elegy for Small Creature and Clandestine Trackbike
programme.desc: Howard finds it difficult to hide his new bike from Pearl, and Clegg manages to make things worse. Long-running comedy, starring Peter Sallis, Frank Thornton and Robert Fyfe.

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. As Dalziel takes it easy at a local B&B after a bout of ill-health, Pascoe returns to his home town to attend the wedding of an old friend. However, the ceremony ends abruptly when a man is found beaten to death. Andy joins his colleague to investigate - but the duo become rapidly embroiled in a plot of intrigue and murder that implicates Peter's father. Warren Clarke, Colin Buchanan, John McEnery and Jim Carter star.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: A car in which a teacher was murdered five years earlier is returned to its owner - the victim's husband. Pullman reopens the unsolved case, hoping to track down the dead woman's secret lover, who is known to have had a small tattoo - a clue that eventually leads to a male prostitute. Detective drama, starring Amanda Redman, James Bolam, Dennis Waterman and Alun Armstrong.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: The team is assigned to protect murderer Susan Kellar, whose recent release from jail has provoked a storm of protest and forced her to go into hiding for her own safety. Unfortunately, they find themselves unable to protect her family from the lethal attentions of a vigilante. Feature-length crime drama, starring James Macpherson.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Stuart 'Recall' McKenzie joins Blue Watch, and there are a series of incidents involving schoolchildren on their half-term break.

Unfortunately the deal backfires, and he's forced to use every ounce of his ingenuity to ensure they both emerge unscathed. Frank Finlay guest stars, with Ian McShane.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Tony is hauled over the coals for smuggling rifles into Britain, and Fitzpatrick blows his top on the eve of McCleod's funeral, angry that disillusioned widow Angela is not allowing it to be done with full military honours.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Drysdale's superiors blame him for McCleod's death, Fitzpatrick is turned down for promotion, and Andy's attempt to prove himself gets Jacko into trouble.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Leela and Sheelagh find themselves at odds over the suspicious death of a baby when it seems accusations of abuse directed at the infant's asylum-seeker parents could be fuelled by racism. Honey accuses Amber of trying to ruin her relationship with Steve - then displays breathtaking hypocrisy by falling into bed with Scott Burnett. Neil's day goes from bad to worse as Phil taunts him about his disgraced father-in-law and Andrea returns to the station, only to plant a kiss on Smithy.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Zubin gives evidence at the inquest into Dominic Fryer's death, where his personal conflicts with Ric are called into question and he is left reconsidering his future. However, on his return to the hospital he discovers a potentially lethal mishap with the oxygen supply and has to race against time to save a patient's life. News of Diane's pregnancy spreads across the wards, but she faces a difficult choice when Connie offers her a prestigious research position. Chrissie warns Owen the baby changes nothing - his relationship is still a terrible mistake.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: The Accident and Emergency department is plunged into darkness by a power cut, leaving a girl terrified and Elliot struggling with his own private dilemmas. Charlie and Baz have also parted company, but out of the gloom of broken relationships Mark and George finally admit their love for each other. Popular medical drama, starring Peter Guinness, Derek Thompson and Rebecca Lacey, with a guest appearance by former Doctor Who Colin Baker.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: A Friday night shift proves a hectic time for the Sun Hill coppers as a childhood friend of Amber's is raped, a drug-dealer is collared and a mugging victim is attacked for a second time - and in the aftermath of all the excitement, Phil's unruly hormones are fired by an encounter with a fellow sex addict. A guilt-ridden Honey decides to tell Steve their relationship is over, Neil pours out his heart to Andrea, and Yvonne learns she's no longer Acting Sergeant - leading to much speculation about her replacement.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Ian seeks a desperate solution to his cashflow problems. Rachel has to face up to her mother and the past. A man from the council has bad news for the squatters.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Richard has a surprise for Rachel, while Sharon plans a controversial evening of entertainment. Early morning visitors at the squat cause a commotion in Albert Square.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Two youths break into a boat moored in a marina and cause an explosion on board, and as a result the Blue Watch team face a race against time to save the crew of a sinking yacht.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The antiques dealer agrees to buy a 19th-century dresser for 65, and finds it is worth 20,000 - but unfortunately, he is not the only one who knows its true value and Beth is conned into parting with it. Ian McShane and Diane Parish star.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim's complex investigation into the death of a sailor is further hampered by the arrival of a bright, shrewd police officer.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Joey gets closer to Roxy, who has left home after rowing with her husband Stan, while Lilo Lil brings Freddie home with a broken leg.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: Jeffrey has one too many to drink, and has to be escorted back to his chalet by Gladys. However, Barry and Yvonne witness the spectacle and conclude the two are enjoying an illicit relationship. Comedy, starring Simon Cadell and Ruth Madoc.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel and Jean take care of Stephen while Penny goes into hospital for a routine operation - but their task is complicated by a case of mistaken identity. Geoffrey Palmer, Judi Dench and Moira Brooker star.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Alvin dresses as a crow, but finds it difficult to walk in a straight line, and the disguise gives Howard an idea as he tries to hide from Pearl. Long-running comedy, starring Peter Sallis, Frank Thornton, Brian Murphy and Robert Fyfe.

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: A doctor is accused of murdering a seriously ill patient with a morphine overdose, a case which echoes a dilemma in Deed's personal life and sets him on the path to potential ruin. Meanwhile, Charlie's HIV-positive friend finds herself in danger of losing her baby to Social Services, and calls on the judge for help. Drama, starring Martin Shaw and Jenny Seagrove.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team is asked to reinvestigate the 1975 death of a union leader, whose body was found in the Thames. As the detectives delve deeper into the case, a financial scandal involving misappropriated funds is uncovered and a Labour peer points the finger of suspicion at the victim's deputy, but Brian's increasingly erratic behaviour threatens to hamper the inquiry. Frances Barber, Kenneth Cranham and Dave Hill guest star.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: The murder of a woman thrown from a bridge appears motiveless until the team is led to a microchip factory where her husband works. Drama, starring James MacPherson, John Michie and Blythe Duff, with Brian Capron, who later rose to fame as serial killer Richard Hillman in Coronation Street and Lovejoy veteran Caroline Langrishe.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Major Tom Cadman discovers that his wife has been having an affair with a rival officer whilst he has been in Norther Ireland.

programme.title: The Bill

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: During a short-staffed bank holiday, Connie tries to persuade the board to ask for Zubin's resignation. Diane insists on working, despite feeling sick, but later collapses and is rushed into theatre - where she loses the baby. Ric tries to make peace with Jess, but a surprise revelation causes him to change his mind, and Mickie comes to a decision about her future. Former EastEnders actor Gary Beadle (Paul Trueman) guest stars as a man who saves his dead brother's wife from a burning building.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Baz is shocked to learn the landlady of a distressed patient is forcing her tenant to sell her body to pay the rent, while Tina goes on a blind date - with Sunny. Charlie finds out that Baz has told the entire department that their relationship is over.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Jaws drop at Sun Hill as June Ackland returns to take up the post of sergeant, a mere two months after her retirement. It's no secret she needs the money to clear Jim's gambling debts - but she makes it plain she's not prepared to be a figure of fun or pity. Meanwhile, Gary finds himself implicated in a money-laundering operation after falling for a woman's charms, and Andrea agonises over whether to tell Neil the reason for her refusal to commit to a relationship.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Good news for Ian means the cold shoulder for Ronnie. Ricky faces a domestic crisis. Dot is horrified when her lodger Nigel has a brush with the law.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Mandy decides that Nigel is the answer to her housing problems. Ronnie's night out with Ian is disappointing, and the women in the Vic are entertained by 'Muscle in Motion'.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Blue Watch are called to a hotel fire and discover blocked escape routes threaten the safety of guests. Elsewhere, Sicknote has finally had enough of politics.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Lady Jane makes a spectacular reappearance in Lovejoy's life just as he decides it is time to settle down - leaving him forced to choose between her and Charlotte. Meanwhile, faithful companion Tinker prepares to retire just as Eric Catchpole makes an unscheduled return to the fold. Last ever episode of the comedy drama, starring Ian McShane, Dudley Sutton, Caroline Langrishe, Phyllis Logan and Chris Jury.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim suspects a man who claims to be receiving menacing phone calls is not telling him the whole story. Detective drama, starring John Nettles and Terence Alexander.

programme.desc: Cousin Shifty moves in with Grandad when he is released from prison, while Aveline gets engaged to Oswald.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: Spike's prospective father-in-law decides it would be a good idea if he were to join the family business. Comedy, starring Paul Shane and Jeffrey Holland.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel and Jean look forward to a peaceful weekend in the country minus the unwelcome presence of 'the gang' - but the locals have different reactions to the absence of the usual crowd. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer, with Frank Middlemass and Joan Sims.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Smiler takes up dancing to impress the woman of his dreams and recruits Truly to help accomplish the task. Comedy, starring Stephen Lewis and Frank Thornton.

programme.desc: The die-hard dame of the Wainthropp Detective Agency sets about flushing out a missing company director who is sought by his creditors. Back at home, Hetty's interfering brother-in-law Frank has come to stay and Robert has flown off to Australia to visit their son Derek.

Gary swears revenge on the female con-artist who inveigled him into the money laundering scam, and Leela is dismayed to learn Amber will be joining her on an advanced driving course, while Andrea tries to avoid exposure as an undercover journalist by promising her editor a scoop on Gabriel's murderous misdeeds.

programme.sub-title: Coronavirus: What Next for Britain? Tonight
programme.desc: With confirmed cases of the coronavirus in Britain on the rise and the UK Government labelling it a 'serious and imminent threat' to public health, Fiona Foster investigates if the authorities here are equipped to deal with the challenge.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: A London softball team, dubbed the Portland Pirates, answers questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then tries to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. Ashton, Jacqueline, Sapphire and Khurram work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Brenda starts a raffle, Dawn prepares herself for a visit, and Moira receives a shock when Cain visits.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Maria voices her suspicions to Ali about Gary, while Tim, Sally and Abi discuss the online article exposing Ray as a sex pest. Beth tears a strip off Daniel and Bethany for jumping into bed together when Sinead's only been dead a few months.

programme.title: The Greek Islands with Julia Bradbury
programme.desc: Julia reaches the island of Chios, where her family's story began. She's joined by her mother Chrissi and together they explore the home of their ancestors. In search of the fascinating history of Mastica, a natural resin only found on Chios, they visit a farm to discover how this mystical and miraculous tree sap has been harvested for thousands of years. After following in the footsteps of legendary Greek poet Homer, who is reputed to have been born on the island, their trip comes to an emotional end when they track down the house where Julia's great-grandparents once lived.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Maria confronts Gary about his shady dealings, Abi turns up at the charity gala with a plan, while Daniel tells the Rovers regulars that he and Bethany are now an item. Elsewhere, Sarah and Adam broach the subject of their wedding with David.

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: When a woman is found dead laid out in the shape of a crucifix on Jesus Green, Will and Geordie are led to a nearby convent where they meet steely Sister Grace, who rules over her flock with an iron fist. Even more sinister is the picture that starts to emerge as they match the nuns to a series of unsolved missing persons cases from the previous five years. Meanwhile, when Leonard's father, Russell, arrives in Grantchester, it's clear there's no love lost between parent and son. Robson Green, Tom Brittney, Tracy-Ann Oberman and Sean Gilder star.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Cold Feet
programme.desc: Adam comes out on top, but his excitement is short-lived when reality hits, while Karen is put in an impossible position. In the wake of her mother's death, Jenny makes a discovery that sends her into a tailspin.John Thomson, James Nesbitt, Fay Ripley, Hermione Norris and Robert Bathurst star in Mike Bullen's long-running comedy drama.

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: The celebrities and their professional partners take to the arena once more, performing routines based on a selection of different dance style. Kevin Kilbane won't be among them, having lost out in last week's skate-off to H. Which of tonight's celebrities will find themselves in the bottom two? Presented by Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby.

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: The Tracy brothers and their friends at International Rescue set out to foil the nefarious plots of the evil Hood. An updated remake of the classic 1960s marionette adventure series, this time featuring computer-animated characters on live-action modeled sets. With the voices of Rosamund Pike, Kayvan Novak and Thomas Brodie-Sangster, with the original Parker - David Graham - returning to voice Lady Penelope's long-serving chauffeur.

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Danny takes on a BMX champion at the UK's national cycling centre. Can he win the race or will he get the cream pie forfeit?.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mrs. Wicket demands that Bean stay in to take delivery of a new lounge chair. He is forced to dress up as Mrs. Wicket to make sure it is delivered!.

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: Part one of two. International Rescue faces their most dangerous mission ever when Tracy Island comes under attack. Guest starring Lee Majors (The Six Million Dollar Man).

programme.title: Craig of the Creek
programme.desc: Craig of the Creek follows a young boy and his two friends as they go on adventures in a world of untamed, kid-dominated wilderness in the creek.

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined in the kitchen by Fast Show star Arabella Weir, top chefs Lisa Goodwin-Allen and Mark Sargeant, and horticultural expert David Domoney, who will be talking about the launch of ITV's Veg Power campaign.

programme.title: Gary Rhodes: The First Rock Star Chef
programme.desc: Documentary paying tribute to the celebrity chef who died in 2019, exploring his impact on both British food and television and showcasing footage from an incomplete final series. Featuring contributions from friends and family, including Gordon Ramsay, Tom Kerridge, Alex Ferguson, and Gary's sons, George and Sam.

programme.title: Save Money: Lose Weight
programme.desc: The British love chocolate, so Sian Williams investigates what makes it so irresistible and gets the public tucking into theCadbury's chocolate bar with 30 per cent less sugar to see if it as tasty as it is healthy. Two more diets are also put to the test - the Meal Prepping for Weight-loss Diet, in which calorie-counted meals are all prepared in advance, and the Diabetes Weight-loss cookbook, road-tested by a woman who is borderline type 2 diabetic.

programme.title: ITV Racing Live
programme.sub-title: Racing on STV: Live from Ascot
programme.desc: Francesca Cumani and Oli Bell present coverage of the 3.35 Betfair Ascot Steeple Chase, which follows races at 1.50, 2.25 and 3.00. Plus, races from 2.05 and 3.15 at Haydock Park, and 2.45 at Wincanton. With analysis from AP McCoy and Mick Fitzgerald, reports by Luke Harvey, Rishi Persad and Alice Plunkett, betting news from Matt Chapman, and commentary by Richard Hoiles.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Compilation of some of the show's most dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shepherd, in which the the last contestant standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: Sing (2016)
programme.desc: A theatre-owning koala sets up a singing competition in a last-ditch bid to stay afloat. Animation, with the voices of Matthew McConaughey, Reese Witherspoon, Seth MacFarlane and Scarlett Johansson.

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Joel Dommett hosts the grand final of the singing contest. Only three of the show's famous contestants have kept their identity a secret, and tonight, these three finalists will be competing for the series trophy before all of them are unmasked. Regular panellists Rita Ora, Jonathan Ross, Davina McCall and Ken Jeong will have one last chance to guess the famous faces hidden behind the bizarre costumes, before all 12 of the show's performers take to the stage together for a special group performance.

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: Emma Willis hosts the penultimate round of the blind auditions in the spinning-chair singing contest, in which celebrity 'coaches' will.i.am,Olly Murs, Tom Jones and Meghan Trainor seek out the nation's best vocal talent. The coveted spaces on the coaches' teams are filling up and as ever, there is a simple twist to the auditions - with the four coaches selecting their teams without being able to see them, looks play no part in the selection process, meaning each singer is chosen on vocal ability alone.

programme.title: Rocky Balboa (2006)
programme.desc: The ageing fighter contemplates a return to the ring when a computer simulation reveals he would have defeated the current world heavyweight champion Mason 'The Line' Dixon, who responds by challenging Rocky to face him for real. Boxing drama sequel, directed by and starring Sylvester Stallone. With Antonio Tarver, Geraldine Hughes, Burt Young, Milo Ventimiglia and Tony Burton.

programme.title: Shopping with Keith Lemon
programme.desc: Keith accompanies DJ Nick Grimshaw on his weekly food shop and helps comedian Katherine Ryan buy a few things for her new house, while also chatting about their life and career.

programme.title: Teach My Pet to Do That
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong opens the doors of his multispecies pet training school to welcome German Shepherd cross Declan and domesticated ferret Biscuit, to see if they can learn to ring a dinner bell to get their owners' attention. The star pet is Chaska, a world-class attack dog that really gets its teeth into the show's host. Plus, the trainers hit the road to train a miniature horse how to be a bellhop in a five-star hotel.

programme.title: Craig of the Creek

programme.title: Ainsley's Caribbean Kitchen
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott takes a culinary tour of Barbados, where he prepares roasted breadfruit, salt fish and lobster, and pineapple French toast with caramelised bananas. He also visits a gully famed for lush vegetation, grapefruits and green monkeys, and catches up with an old friend who runs a beachside snack shop out of a converted bus.

programme.title: Living on the Veg
programme.desc: Henry Firth and Ian Theasby serve up their version of classic shepherd's pie, a simple recipe for fudgy chocolate cookies, sushi with two different fillings and a bakewell tart. Their guest is chef and baker Sal Dhalla, who cooks her roasted vegetable farinata.

programme.title: The Greek Islands with Julia Bradbury
programme.desc: Julia reaches the island of Chios, where her family's story began. She's joined by her mother Chrissi and together they explore the home of their ancestors. In search of the fascinating history of Mastica, a natural resin only found on Chios, they visit a farm to discover how this mystical and miraculous tree sap has been harvested for thousands of years. After following in the footsteps of legendary Greek poet Homer, who is reputed to have been born on the island, their trip comes to an emotional end when they track down the house where Julia's great-grandparents once lived.

programme.title: The Metro: A Rail Life Story
programme.desc: All hands are on deck as the metro system prepares for the busiest day of the year - the Great North Run. This year, a new and untested station in South Shields is at the centre of things. One of the event's regular runners prepares for a personal return to the course, as he runs in tribute to a friend.

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: Emma Willis hosts the penultimate round of the blind auditions in the spinning-chair singing contest, in which celebrity 'coaches' will.i.am,Olly Murs, Tom Jones and Meghan Trainor seek out the nation's best vocal talent. The coveted spaces on the coaches' teams are filling up and as ever, there is a simple twist to the auditions - with the four coaches selecting their teams without being able to see them, looks play no part in the selection process, meaning each singer is chosen on vocal ability alone.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.sub-title: The Chase: I'm a Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as 2018 I'm a Celebrity campmates Rita Simons, Malique Thompson-Dwyer, Fleur East and James McVey try to win as much money as they dare before teaming up in the final round against one of the show's five quiz experts. But which Chaser will they be facing tonight?.

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: The celebrities and their professional partners take to the ice once more, hoping they can do enough to impress judges Christopher Dean, Jayne Torvill, Ashley Banjo and John Barrowman and avoid a place in the bottom two. Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby present the action, including a musical interlude from the Script, accompanying a routine by the professional skaters.

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: As campaigning for the 1970 general election gets under way in Oxford, racial tensions escalate in the city and a clash between two rival gangs leads Morse and Thursday to the door of a familiar face, where they discover the influence of a right wing organisation hoping to win an Oxford seat. Things get worse at an Indian restaurant, where a mysterious disappearance and a shocking murder put even the strongest family loyalties to the test. Crime drama, starring Shaun Evans and Roger Allam.

programme.title: Bradley Walsh & Son: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: On the final leg of their journey, the pair continue through the snow to New Hampshire. Here, they meet rally-driving champion Tim O'Neil who gives them a crash course in driving in the ice and snow before they take on an intense time trial. The pair travel on to Maine, where they take part in some wilderness training, before bidding farewell to the RV and heading out into the extremely choppy seas for some lobster fishing. Before heading home, the pair look back on some of their favourite moments from the trip.

programme.title: Piers Morgan's Life Stories
programme.desc: Harry Redknapp talks about his life and career as one of the most respected and experienced football managers in the modern game, as well as his victorious I'm a Celebrity appearance in 2018, when he was crowned King of the Jungle. He discusses the many twists and turns of his rollercoaster life, including a road accident in 1990 in which his friend Brian Tiler died. Harry also opens up about a dramatic dawn raid on his house and the death threats he received when he became manager of Southampton.

programme.title: Heathrow: Britain's Busiest Airport
programme.desc: The documentary going behind the scenes of the London airport returns for a fifth season. Inside the terminal, seasoned pro Demi dishes out deals for delayed passengers, while outside on the airfield, Ian is on the runway as it goes into lockdown with a full armed police presence. For the first time this series, viewers will also see the work of the Border Force's canine drugs detection team - Rachel and her dog Cole, who in his career has intercepted more than 1million worth of class-A contraband. Narrated by Julie Walters.

programme.title: Holiday Horrors: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Documentary series looking at what can go wrong on holiday, including a ski trip that became a fight for survival, a horrific case of sunburn, and what happened when a wildfire spread across the holiday hotspot of Javea in Spain. Presented by Jamie Theakston.

programme.desc: Adam and Karen's future is thrown into jeopardy by an unexpected offer, and David is in turmoil over his growing feelings for Robyn. While Jenny braces herself for her first mammogram after her treatment for cancer, Pete helps their son Adam realise his dream. John Thomson, James Nesbitt, Fay Ripley, Hermione Norris and Robert Bathurst star in the concluding instalment of the ninth season of Mike Bullen's long-running comedy drama, with guest appearances by Frances Barber and Paul Ritter.

programme.title: The BRITs at 40
programme.desc: Jack Whitehall narrates a look back at the history of the awards ceremony, featuring archive footage of some of the most memorable moments, from Oasis and Blur's rivalry to Stormzy's attack on the government, and classic performances by Adele, Rihanna and Drake. The programme also recalls less successful moments, from the infamous 1989 ceremony hosted by Mick Fleetwood and Sam Fox, and Madonna struggles with her cape. Featuring interviews with stars including Robbie Williams, Mel B, Mick Fleetwood, Little Mix, Sam Smith, Ellie Goulding, Sharon Osbourne, Bros, Dua Lipa, Rick Astley and Tom Jones.

programme.title: Best Walks with a View with Julia Bradbury
programme.desc: An exploration of scenic Britain on foot, beginning in north Wales where she heads out beside the Menai Straits overlooking Snowdonia. During the trek, Julia seeks out the lost prototype of the first ever Land Rover, which locals believe may be buried in the Anglesey sand-dunes where its inventor first put it through trials almost 70 years ago. The expert walker also discovers why Prince William and his wife have a soft spot for the romantic St Llanddwyn Island, home to the Welsh St Valentine. Finally, she meets mussel and oyster pickers, getting to taste their wares in a sunset beach picnic.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants who have never met before pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. programme.title: Australia with Julia Bradbury
programme.desc: Presenter Julia Bradbury continues her epic journey across Australia, exploring all four corners as she finds out about the continent and the people who live there. Her next step is the Blue Mountains, a rugged region in New South Wales. Along the way she has a go at paddle boarding with pooches, meets Australia's favourite koala and has a chat with fashion designer Jenny Kee. She also takes a ride on the world's steepest railway, and her hike through the mountains ends with a sighting of the bowerbird.

programme.title: The BRIT Awards 2020
programme.desc: Jack Whitehall hosts the 40th edition of the annual music awards. Stormzy, Michael Kiwanuka, Lewis Capaldi, Dave and Harry Styles are in the running for Album of the Year, while Celeste has been announced as the recipient of this year's Rising Star Award. The show will feature performances from Mabel, Harry Styles, Stormzy, Billie Eilish, Lewis Capaldi and Celeste.

programme.desc: The evidence is examined as Jeremy's trial begins, with dramatic and conflicting witness testimony being given before the jury and the packed public gallery, and the jury give their verdict on what really happened that fateful night at White House Farm. programme.title: James Martin's French Adventure
programme.desc: The next leg of his trip sees James heading to Bresse, home of one of the country's most famous ingredients - the Bresse chicken. He visits a chicken farm to discover just why these birds are so special, and gets the chance to cook his own. He also meets Georges Blanc, one of his culinary heroes, before attending the annual Michelin star football tournament.

programme.title: Harry Redknapp's Sandbanks Summer
programme.desc: Former football manager Harry Redknapp welcomes celebrity friends to his house in Sandbanks, Britain's most exclusive and expensive seaside resort, offering an insight into this unique part of the British south coast peninsula. In the first episode, Harry is joined by Neil Razor' Ruddock and Joe Pasquale. Neil is considering a move to the area, so Harry takes him and Joe to see a very desirable 5 million penthouse with some of the best views Sandbanks has to offer.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Tara tells Chesney that he's trashed the Freshco's brand and she's terminating their contract, Ed is convinced that Danny has corrupted James, and Maria tells a thrilled Gary that she'd love to marry him.

programme.title: Cilla: The Lost Tapes
programme.desc: Following her death, Cilla Black's family found a stash of films and behind-the-scenes footage from her personal video collection, along with hours of audio recording of Cilla telling her life story. Narrated by Sheridan Smith, this documentary includes interviews with the family and friends who knew Cilla best, as they watch the lost footage for the first time and recall their memories of a TV icon.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.desc: In 10 years Airbnb has grown into a multimillion-dollar global entity - and revolutionised the way people travel. But there are claims that short-term lets not only threaten the future of traditional hotels, but could be contributing to housing shortages - as well as driving up the cost of properties. Jonathan Maitland investigates.

programme.title: Tyson Fury: The Gypsy King
programme.desc: The heavyweight celebrates a victory over Thomas Schwartz in Las Vegas by enjoying a night of heavy drinking back home in Morecambe and video-calling rival Anthony Joshua. This angers his wife Paris, who is reminded of his alcohol abuse during his years of depression, and Fury looks to make amends by treating the family to a day out in Blackpool and booking a family holiday. The boxer then heads to Marbella with trainer Ben Davison, before preparing to face his next opponent Otto Wallin back in Vegas, in what proves to be a challenging fight.

programme.title: Save Money: Lose Weight
programme.desc: Over the past 25 years, portion sizes have increased by 100 per cent - and plates have got bigger too - none of which is good news for people's diet. With this in mind, Ranj Singh checks out the breakfast buffet to see whether people know how many calories they are piling on their plates and Sian Williams tests off-the-shelf portion-control gadgets, including smaller cutlery to help eat more slowly. Plus, two more diets are put to the test - the Metabolism Reset Diet, based around a detox for the liver, and Bosh! Healthy Vegan, which means ditching the junk.

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: When a woman is found dead laid out in the shape of a crucifix on Jesus Green, Will and Geordie are led to a nearby convent where they meet steely Sister Grace, who rules over her flock with an iron fist. Even more sinister is the picture that starts to emerge as they match the nuns to a series of unsolved missing persons cases from the previous five years. Meanwhile, when Leonard's father, Russell, arrives in Grantchester, it's clear there's no love lost between parent and son. Robson Green, Tom Brittney, Tracy-Ann Oberman and Sean Gilder star.

programme.desc: Sarah Moore and Jay Blades search the homes of former MPs Ann Widdecombe and Edwina Currie for unloved items that can be transformed and sold on to raise money for charity.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How tiny shreds of evidence, such as a tooth filling or fibres from clothing, can be crucial in proving the guilt or innocence of suspects.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Summer and Joseph McStay, who vanished from their home San Diego, California, with their two children in February 2010, leaving their pets and possessions behind. It transpired the pair were being chased by various debt collection agents and CCTV footage suggested they had crossed into Mexico. Subsequent to this documentary's first airing, their bodies were recovered from a shallow grave in the Californian desert, though the identity of their killers remains unknown.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Seattle-based punk rocker Brian Barton, guitarist with As Fate Would Have It. The 25-year-old vanished in March 2005, after a bout of depression during which he left the band, broke up with his fiancee and cut ties with his closest friends.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Shopaholic Courtney wants to look at every dress in Kleinfeld. Brianna wants a frock themed on 50 Shades, while Angela craves a tasteful gown for her circus wedding.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at one of the world's most prestigious bridal salons.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Cat and her fiancee Nicole both need dresses for their beach wedding, and the team are challenged to find them two different gowns that are still complementary.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress

programme.desc: Sarah Moore and Jay Blades search the homes of former MPs Ann Widdecombe and Edwina Currie for unloved items that can be transformed and sold on to raise money for charity.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part two of two. With severe lymphedema Mercedes can barely stand, and her family helps her care for her young kids. To successfully lose weight she must confront her past trauma.

programme.title: Inside the Mind of a Serial Killer
programme.desc: The crimes of Anthony Shore, who was responsible for the slayings of one woman and three girls, and was known as the Tourniquet Killer.

programme.title: The Lady Killers
programme.desc: How a love triangle between two sisters and one of their husbands led to a shocking murder when Sabah Khan stabbed sibling Saima Khan in Luton in 2006. Here, detectives review the case that proved love can ruin any family bond.

programme.title: British Police: Our Toughest Cases
programme.desc: In 1991, 13 children collapsed in a Lincolnshire hospital - four of them died. DS Stuart Clifton reveals the chilling discovery that serving nurse Beverley Allitt was a child serial killer.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How clues found in common substances can help investigators solve homicide cases.

programme.title: Crime Stories
programme.desc: The case of prominent American atheist Madalyn Murray O'Hair, who together with her son and grandaughter, was abducted and murdered by David Roland Waters, a convicted felon out on parole, and fellow career criminals Gary Karr and Danny Fry in September 1995.

programme.desc: The case of a respected Kentucky businesswoman, found bludgeoned and stabbed to death in her home. Detectives followed a long path to pursue her killer.

programme.desc: Dr Danni Dusek helps her friend's cat that keeps fighting with its neighbour. Meanwhile, Dr Peter Ricci struggles to get close to Lottie the ferocious and frightened Chihuahua.
